Governance

The Governance criterion pertains to how a corporation conducts its policies, actions, and guidelines. This aspect of ESG aids investors in their decision-making, since it is crucial to understand the risks and growth opportunities associated with a corporationâ€™s governance.
Examples of governance factors include:
  • Company leadership
  • Shareholder rights
  • Corruption and bribery
  • Diversity, structure, and role of board composition
  • Tax strategy
  • Whistleblower programs
  • Donations and political lobbying
  • Executive compensation and policies
